alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 3:27AM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pequannock River Below Macopin Dam affecting Passaic and Morris Counties. For the Pequannock River...including Macopin Dam...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pequannock River below Macopin Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Road closures begin in both Butler and Bloomingdale due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:55 AM EST Thursday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:55 AM EST Thursday was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday evening and continue rising to 5.6 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.9 feet on 03/07/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Pequannock River Macopin Dam 5.5 5.9 Thu 2 am 5.3 4.6 Crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
